sub_title: Data Analyst @ Booking.com | MSc in Economic Development | BSc Economics
summary:
Economist and Master in Economic Development, with more than 5 years of experience, in multinational brands like Microsoft, Itaú Unibanco and Booking.com. My main area of work is translate complex data into simple answers, from account managers level to managing directors.

My technical background covers Economics, Business Intelligence, Econometrics and related fields, with different reporting tools, such as Tableau, SAP Analytics Cloud and Google Data Studio, and different data management tools such as SAP BW and Big Query. At the moment,  I have been using Hadoop to feed Tableau reports, automated with Oozie. I also have a wide knowledge in data concept, business analysis and workflow design.  I can code in SQL,  Python, PySpark, SAS and basic R. 

Besides my quantitative skills, I am a polyglot. I am able to speak Portuguese (C2), English (C1), French (B2), Spanish (B1), Brazilian Sign Language (LIBRAS), Italian (A1) and Dutch (A2).

projects.title:
Fuzzy Measurement of Water Vulnerability -
 An analysis of the Brazilian municipalities
projects.description:
Vulnerability is the degree to which a given system, or part of it, can react negatively duringthe occurrence of a dangerous event. Thus, the lack of water is a type of dangerous event,being classified as a water vulnerability, also known as water poverty. Water poverty is asocially constructed process, and reproduced through multiple socio-political processes ofexclusion and discrimination, ranging from the macro level to the microcosm of households.Vulnerability is measured with a risk indicator. In the case of water vulnerability, this measurement is made by the water poverty index (WPI). However, the present WPI presentsproblems, such as difficulty in obtaining all indicators, the main one being the imprecisionof the variables. Thus, the objective was to model these uncertainties using a more appropriate methodology: fuzzy logic. As a case study, the fuzzy water poverty index is appliedin 5,655 Brazilian municipalities. Based on data, the 2010 Census and the National Sanitation Information System. Access to water sources and basic sanitation (water and sewage)were analyzed. As a work tool, MATLAB and Excel software were used. Two different wayswere used to aggregate the final outputs: weighted average, and network of connected fuzzyinference systems. Final results of the Water Poverty Fuzzy Index (WPFI) indicate thatBrazilian municipalities have managed to democratize access to water. On the other hand,sanitation did not accompany this process. This distinct combination leads to the idea thatBrazil does not have a water vulnerability situation, however, the lack of sanitation is whatbrings Brazilian municipalities, and consequently their population, to a situation of water
vulnerability.

profile_positions.description:
Part of Operational Insights team. 

Main Function:
Technical Lead of Bonus Tracking Reporting (for AMs till Regional Directors, ~1.5k end users Americas, EMEA and APAC) ) to help internal stakeholders understand their/team performance. Translate Bonus framework logic to PySpark (using Hadoop tables) and Tableau.

Support Data Governance by building modular corrections on tables, in order to fix data anomalies coming from source systems which might affect reporting

Technical Lead (during H1/2021) of Operational Performance Reporting (for Individuals and Managers). 

Technical Functions:
 • Build and Design Report via Cloudera Hadoop to Tableau. Using tmux (vim) in order to write PySpark codes to build tables Hadoop. All reports are automated via Oozie and Argo (Kubernertis).
• Migrated codes from SQL to PySpark (Black Standard). 
• Migrated workflows in Oozie to Argo (Kubernertis).
• Developed controls for data and coding to improve report reliability and ease maintenance.
profile_positions.title: Reporting Analyst
Business Analyst

profile_positions.description: Position acquired due to master studies. Develops research (master thesis) for the University of Campinas with support of the Brazilian Ministery of Science. The outcome of the research is a algorithm using Fuzzy Sets to develop a risk indicator to determine people’s water poverty.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Researcher
Business Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Main function:  Customer behavior mapping; conceptual thinking for marketing strategies; geographical analysis for FP&A (specially ROI); product owner of insurance products purchased with credit card miles; KYC activities
Technical functions: Use of SAS enterprise guide 9.0. Statistical tests, cluster analysis and patterns identifications; Data mining with SAS and Hadoop (HIVE) programs using SQL and PROC SQL; Construction, application and analysis of A/B test on SAS and SAS CI; Neural Decision Trees construction and analysis (machine learning technique) on SAS.
profile_positions.title: CRM Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Credit Risk Intern at Brazil’s biggest privet bank, Itaú-Unibanco. Focused on information and intelligence of credit retail. Used to track credit data from the market and analyze the day over day changes. Also performed data mining, organizing the impacts of each variable correction in the system. Assist in the search of new data to purchase. Handle all administrative tasks related to compliance issues.
Track management of the controls of restrictive credit notes. Send databases to other servers. Use of SAS Enterprise Guide 9.0.
profile_positions.title: Credit Risk Intern

profile_positions.description: Business Intelligence and Finance intern focused on analyzing key metrics.
profile_positions.title: Finance and BI Intern
